com.example.crossfire

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.crossfire.Bullet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject

    public class Bullet
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameObject
    A game object and the main projectile in the game. These are created and fired by turrets. They move in a straight line and either go off screen, run into other turrets and inflict damage, run into other turret's shields and are destroyed, or run into powerups and destroy them for the user to gain.

      Bullet(float x, float y, int direction, int velocity, int color, Turret shooter)
      Bullet constructor.

      Returns the integer amount of damage the bullet inflicts when colliding with another game object

      Returns the turret which fired the bullet

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(float x,
              float y,
              int direction,
              int velocity,
              int color,
              Turret shooter)
        Bullet constructor. Creates a bullet by setting its x and y positions on the game screen, the direction it was fired, its velocity, its color, and the turret who shot the bullet.
        Parameters:
        x - X position in the gamepanel
        y - Y position in the gamepanel
        direction - Direction the bullet has been fired/will move in
        velocity - Velocity that the bullet is travelling at
        color - Color of the bullet
        shooter - Turret which fired the bullet

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns whether or not the bullet is currently active/moving
        Returns:
        True if the bullet is active, False otherwise

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean isActive)
        Sets a bullet to be either active or inactive
        Parameters:
        isActive - If true, the bullet will be active and will be drawn and move on screen. If false, the bullet will be inactive and not drawn or move.

      • setDamage

        public void setDamage(int damage)
        Sets the amount of damage the bullet inflicts
        Parameters:
        damage - The new integer value of the bullet's damage

      • getDamage

        Returns the integer amount of damage the bullet inflicts when colliding with another game object
        Returns:
        The integer amount of damage the bullet inflicts

        public void update(int frameCount)
